meanings.definition: Remove air or gas from (a liquid)
meanings.sent1: The chef deaerated the broth before adding the vegetables.
meanings.sent2: She deaerated the soda by stirring it gently.
meanings.sent3: The fish seemed surprised when the water was deaerated, making it easier to breathe.
meanings.sent4: The deaerated lake was as calm as a sleeping baby.
meanings.sent5: After the machine deaerated the milk, it tasted fresher than ever.

meanings.definition: To remove air or gas from (a substance)
meanings.sent1: The scientist deaerated the solution to ensure accurate results.
meanings.sent2: He deaerated the paint before applying it to the wall.
meanings.sent3: The deaerated balloon refused to float, much to the children's amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter deaerated the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The deaerated tires hugged the road tightly, providing excellent grip.
